ygData.subject: Exception when using AdaptiveRevisitFrontier
ygData.msgSnippet: I tried to run a simple crawl using the AdaptiveRevisitFrontier. I quickly got an exception, though. The exception is Exception in thread StartNextJob

I tried to run a simple crawl using the AdaptiveRevisitFrontier. I
quickly =
got an exception, though. The exception is

Exception in thread "StartNextJ=
ob" java.lang.RuntimeException:
Unsupported type: java.lang.Double
        =
at org.archive.util.JmxUtils.getOpenType(JmxUtils.java:235)
        at org.=
archive.util.JmxUtils.getOpenType(JmxUtils.java:206)
        at
org.archive=
.crawler.admin.CrawlJob.addCrawlOrderAttributes(CrawlJob.java:1453)
       =
 at
org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJob.addCrawlOrderAttributes(CrawlJob.jav=
a:1460)
        at
org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJob.addCrawlOrderAttribut=
es(CrawlJob.java:1460)
        at
org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJob.buildM=
BeanInfo(CrawlJob.java:1257)

        at
org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJob=
.setupForCrawlStart(CrawlJob.java:789)
        at
org.archive.crawler.admin=
.CrawlJobHandler.startNextJobInternal(CrawlJobHandler.java:1131)
        at=

org.archive.crawler.admin.CrawlJobHandler$3.run(CrawlJobHandler.java:1114)=

        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

This happens immediately =
after I start the job. In the console, the
job's status shows up as "Prepar=
ing" and never gets further than that.

I am running Heritrix 1.6 on Window=
s 2000. I was able to successfully
run a crawl using DecideScope and BdbFro=
ntier. I more or less took the
order.xml from this crawl and tweaked it to =
make it
AdaptiveRevisitFrontier-friendly (I added ChangeEvaluator and
WaitE=
valuator processors in the right places).

In the exception, there is refer=
ence to the class Double. I checked
order.xml and found that the only confi=
guration setting that is
specified as a double is the Change factor in the =
WaitEvaluator
processor. I hacked order.xml to make that a float, but in th=
e end I
still got the same exception.

Has anyone ever seen this error, or =
has even gotten
AdaptiveRevisitFrontier to work? If so, could you please sh=
are your
experience with getting it set up?

I can provide my order.xml fil=
e as a follow-up to this post.

Thanks,
Will
